com.panasonic.toughpad.android.api.barcode

Interface BarcodeReader


  • public interface BarcodeReader
    BarcodeReader represents the barcode reader device.
    Use BarcodeReaderManager class to get BarcodeReader objects

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int BARCODE_TYPE_CAMERA
      Indicates the reader is capable of reading one-dimensional and two-dimensional barcodes via the device's rear camera.
      static int BARCODE_TYPE_ONE_DIMENSIONAL
      Indicates the reader is only capable of reading one-dimensional barcodes.
      static int BARCODE_TYPE_TWO_DIMENSIONAL
      Indicates the reader is capable of reading both one-dimensional and two-dimensional barcodes.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addBarcodeListener(BarcodeListener listener)
      Adds a BarcodeListener to receive events from this BarcodeReader object.
      void clearBarcodeListener()
      Removes all BarcodeListeners added to this BarcodeReader object so they no longer receive events.
      void disable()
      Power Off/Disconnect the BarcodeReader
      void enable(long timeout)
      Power On/Connect the BarcodeReader.
      int getBarcodeType()
      Determine the kind of Barcode device being used.
      int getBatteryCharge()
      Gets battery charge (only for external barcode reader) in percentage.
      java.lang.String getDeviceFirmwareVersion()
      Returns the device's firmware of the BarcodeReader.
      java.lang.String getDeviceName()
      Returns the device name of the BarcodeReader.
      java.lang.String getDeviceSerialNumber()
      Returns the device's serial number of the BarcodeReader.
      boolean isBatteryCharging()
      Determines if the battery is being charged (Only for external devices).
      boolean isEnabled()
      Check if the device is enabled (Status returned using state based on the API, not hardware state).
      boolean isExternal()
      Used to determine if the barcode module is an external or an internal device
      An internal device is defined as barcode module in-built into the unit
      boolean isHardwareTriggerAvailable()
      This is used to determine if the Hardware trigger is available for the module.
      boolean isHardwareTriggerEnabled()
      This can be used to determine if the hardware trigger is currently enabled
      void pressSoftwareTrigger(boolean press)
      This would either press or release the trigger based on the argument.
      void removeBarcodeListener(BarcodeListener listener)
      Remove a listener so it does no longer receives events from this BarcodeReader object.
      void setHardwareTriggerEnabled(boolean enable)
      Enables / disables the Hardware Trigger.

    • Field Detail

      • BARCODE_TYPE_ONE_DIMENSIONAL

        static final int BARCODE_TYPE_ONE_DIMENSIONAL
        Indicates the reader is only capable of reading one-dimensional barcodes. Barcode type of BARCODE_TYPE_ONE_DIMENSIONAL = 1.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BARCODE_TYPE_TWO_DIMENSIONAL

        static final int BARCODE_TYPE_TWO_DIMENSIONAL
        Indicates the reader is capable of reading both one-dimensional and two-dimensional barcodes. Barcode type of BARCODE_TYPE_TWO_DIMENSIONAL = 2.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BARCODE_TYPE_CAMERA

        static final int BARCODE_TYPE_CAMERA
        Indicates the reader is capable of reading one-dimensional and two-dimensional barcodes via the device's rear camera. Barcode type of BARCODE_TYPE_CAMERA = 3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • enable

        void enable(long timeout)
     throws BarcodeException,
            java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Power On/Connect the BarcodeReader.
        This method is used to enable/power-on the device in the given the time (timeout).
        Parameters:
        timeout - Timeout in milliseconds which indicates the maximum time that can be taken by the device to enable itself
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if timeout is negative
        BarcodeException - communication error, connection errors or any other related errors
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if already enabled
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - If device is not enabled in the given 'timeout' time.

      • disable

        void disable()
      throws BarcodeException
        Power Off/Disconnect the BarcodeReader
        Throws:
        BarcodeException - communication error, connection errors or any other related errors
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if already disabled.

      • getBarcodeType

        int getBarcodeType()
        Determine the kind of Barcode device being used. See BARCODE_TYPE_*** constants.
        Returns:
        the barcode type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if already disabled.

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled()
        Check if the device is enabled (Status returned using state based on the API, not hardware state).
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean value, True if the device is enabled, false otherwise.

      • getBatteryCharge

        int getBatteryCharge()
              throws BarcodeException
        Gets battery charge (only for external barcode reader) in percentage. The battery mentioned is an independent battery source connected exclusively for the barcode module.
        This function would return a negative value if no battery is present.
        Returns:
        Returns the percentage of battery left. -1 if the barcode module has no battery
        Throws:
        BarcodeException - communication error, connection errors or any other related errors
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if device is currently disabled

      • isBatteryCharging

        boolean isBatteryCharging()
                   throws BarcodeException
        Determines if the battery is being charged (Only for external devices). The battery mentioned is an independent battery source connected exclusively for the barcode module.
        This function would return false if no battery is present.
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean value, True if the device is being charged, false otherwise. False if the barcode module does not have a battery connected to it
        Throws:
        BarcodeException - communication error, connection errors or any other related errors
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if device is currently disabled

      • isHardwareTriggerAvailable

        boolean isHardwareTriggerAvailable()
        This is used to determine if the Hardware trigger is available for the module. A Hardware trigger is defined as a dedicated physical button which can trigger the barcode module.
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean value, True if the trigger is enabled, false otherwise. *

      • setHardwareTriggerEnabled

        void setHardwareTriggerEnabled(boolean enable)
                        throws BarcodeException
        Enables / disables the Hardware Trigger. Does nothing if no hardware trigger is present.
        Parameters:
        enable - true to enable the trigger, false to disable
        Throws:
        BarcodeException - communication error, connection errors or any other related errors
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if device is currently disabled *

      • isHardwareTriggerEnabled

        boolean isHardwareTriggerEnabled()
        This can be used to determine if the hardware trigger is currently enabled
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean value, True if the trigger is enabled, false otherwise. False if no hardware trigger is present

      • pressSoftwareTrigger

        void pressSoftwareTrigger(boolean press)
                   throws BarcodeException
        This would either press or release the trigger based on the argument. On a camera-based reader, calling the trigger with press as 'true' would display the UI used to scan the barcode and on calling the trigger with false would hide the UI
        Parameters:
        press - on true to press the trigger, false to release
        Throws:
        BarcodeException - communication error, connection errors or any other related errors
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if device is currently disabled

      • addBarcodeListener

        void addBarcodeListener(BarcodeListener listener)
        Adds a BarcodeListener to receive events from this BarcodeReader object. The BarcodeListener's onRead() method will be invoked when a barcode has been scanned. If the same listener is attempted to be added twice, then this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if listener is null

      • removeBarcodeListener

        void removeBarcodeListener(BarcodeListener listener)
        Remove a listener so it does no longer receives events from this BarcodeReader object. If the listener was not added via addBarcodeListener() then this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to remove
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if listener is null

      • clearBarcodeListener

        void clearBarcodeListener()
        Removes all BarcodeListeners added to this BarcodeReader object so they no longer receive events.

      • getDeviceName

        java.lang.String getDeviceName()
        Returns the device name of the BarcodeReader.
        Returns:
        Device name as String, null if no name is found

      • getDeviceFirmwareVersion

        java.lang.String getDeviceFirmwareVersion()
                                   throws BarcodeException
        Returns the device's firmware of the BarcodeReader.
        Returns:
        Firmware as String, null if no firmware version is found
        Throws:
        BarcodeException - communication error, connection errors or any other related errors
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if device is currently disabled *

      • getDeviceSerialNumber

        java.lang.String getDeviceSerialNumber()
                                throws BarcodeException
        Returns the device's serial number of the BarcodeReader.
        Returns:
        Serial as String, null if no serial number is found
        Throws:
        BarcodeException - communication error, connection errors or any other related errors
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if device is currently disabled *

      • isExternal

        boolean isExternal()
        Used to determine if the barcode module is an external or an internal device
        An internal device is defined as barcode module in-built into the unit
        Returns:
        boolean, true if the device is external and false if device is internal *
